quizzes.question: What is the correct extension to use when saving PHP files?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Getting Started[/h1]

You can run, save, and share your PHP codes on our [b]Code Playground[/b], without installing any additional software.
[note]Reference this lesson if you need to install the software on your computer. [/note]
To start using PHP, your first step is to install a web server on your PC, and then install PHP. 
The easiest way to get PHP is to install a tool called [b]XAMPP[/b]. It includes Apache, MySQL, and PHP, and it's available for free. Download and install XAMPP from www.xampp.org
Open the XAMPP Control Panel and start the Apache web server. [img id="2778" width="100%"]
The only thing you need to code PHP is a basic [b]text editor[/b]. We will use [b]NotePad++[/b], which is available for free.
Create a file, and write a sample PHP statement: [img id="2780" width="100%"]
Save it as [b]someFile.php[/b] in the Apache root folder (In Windows, it is usually the folder [b]C:\xampp\htdocs[/b]).
Now, open your web browser and go to [b]http://localhost/someFile.php[/b] [img id="2781" width="100%"]
[note]Do not forget to save your PHP files with the [b].php[/b] extension.[/note]
